definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: appar. demon (loan-word from As. šêdu, a protecting spirit, esp. of bull-colossus, Dl:Pa 153 f.; WB 645 COT:De 32:17 Zim:KAT3. 460 f., 455, 649; cf. Aram. [[שֵׁידָא]], 4i0do0 demon, and (perh.) Ph. n.pr. [[גדשד]] Nö:ZMG x1ii (1888), 481 Lzb:249; orig. √[[שׁוד]] ( = Ar. sa0da rule) acc. to Thes Baud:Sem. Rei. i. 130 ff. Dl:WB al.; > Ar. s9d (III, IV aid, Hom:ZMG x1vi (1892), 529, against this Zim:l. c);—[[תִזְבְּחוּ לַשֵּׁדִים לאׁ אֱלֽהַּ]] De 32:17 (cf. Dr), Ps 106:37 (human sacrifice).
